article.bibl: Fig.1 The book-wheel, from The Various and Ingenious Machines of Agostino Ramelli (1588). Reproduced by permission of the Huntington Library, San Marino, California.
Fig.2 A legal bond written in to the back leaf of a book of Chaucer's verse. Image courtesy of the Beinecke Rare Bok and Manuscript Library, Yale University.
Fig. 3 A flyleaf from Francis Beaumont and John Fletcher's play, Philaster (1661), used to record rents. Image courtesy of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.
Fig. 4 A printed political pamphlet with a handwritten recipe. Image courtesy of the Master and Fellows of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge.
Fig. 5 A Handwritten recipe stitched into the title page of a printed biblical commentary. Image courtesy of the Special Collections Department at the University of Birmingham.
Fig. 6 Vittore Carpaccio, Vision of St. Augustine, oil on cavnas, c. 1502. Venice, Scuola di San Giorgio degli Schiavoni (photo: Erich Lessing/Art Resource, New York).

Fig. 7 The "Blason de la Chaire," a love poem to a piece of furniture: here, the throne or "chaire." Gilles Corrozet, Les Blasons domestiqves contenantz la decoration d'une maison honneste, & du mesnage estant en icelle (1593). Houghton Library, Typ 515.39.299, sig. 18r.

Fig.8 The blazon of the study. Gilles Corrozet, Les Blasons domestiqves contenantz la decoration d'une maison honneste, & du mesnage estant en icelle (1539). Houghton Library, Typ 515.39.299, sig. 33r.
